results.title: Kimberley Cops. Ep. 1: Follow the rock
results.creator_credit: Paul Roy, Australian Broadcasting Corporation and Iguana Films (AU)
results.brief_description: ‘Kimberly cops’ is a 4-part documentary about policemen working in the isolated areas of Western Australia. Wyndham is a remote town 3200 kms from Perth - the population of 800 is largely Aboriginal. Policemen and their families move from the city to this isolated town to work, forced to adapt to a very inhospitable environment. The 1600 sq. km beat covers bush, river and rugged coastline, complete with large saltwater crocodiles. The area is made up of cattle stations, aboriginal settlements and tourist resorts. The episode follows a team of policemen and local Aboriginal volunteers who search for a missing tourist. The trip involves camping and travelling in rugged conditions in which the men have to be self-sufficient. With heat and dehydration being the major concern, they track and find the man with a broken ankle, desperate for a cigarette. The informative and entertaining documentary will interest and inform viewers. Narrated by Peter Turnbull.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Paul Roy, Australian Broadcasting Corporation and Iguana Films (AU)

results.title: Kimberley Cops. Ep. 02: End of the road
results.creator_credit: Paul Roy, Film Finance Corporation Australia and Iguana Films (AU)
results.brief_description: This episode of “Kimberley Cops”, a documentary series that relates the hardships and hazards for police stationed in isolated parts of Australia, focuses on the experiences of Hills Creek police officers. The rain season has arrived and we follow them as they travel to areas which will soon become inaccessible by road. The program captures the efforts of police to rectify past relations with Aboriginals in the area, particularly children, in developing mutual trust and respect.

results.title: Kimba the white lion. Volume 7
results.brief_description: Contains three episodes from the classic television series (fans of the original series note that these are not the original voices) of Kimba, King of the Jungle, a bravehearted white lion cub. Kimbas adventures bring him across new friends and sometimes some very unfriendly visitors, which often lands him in a spot of bother. However he always bounces back with enthusiasm and life, willing to give anything a go. The episodes on this tape are: ‘The Cobweb caper’, ‘A Friend indeed’ and the ‘Bad baboon’.

results.title: Kim / by Rudyard Kipling
results.creator_credit: John Davies, David Conroy and London Film Productions
results.brief_description: Rudyard Kipling’s classic tale of the orphaned son of a British soldier in India at the time of the British Raj is here brought to the screen with great enthusiasm. Kim and his horseman friend who belongs to the British secret service experience many adventures. These adventures eventually lead him into a friendship with a Buddhist lama in search of the river which sprang from the ground when the Lord Buddha shot an arrow, so he joins him in his quest, as he too searches for his own origins. Stars Peter O’Toole and Bryan Brown.

results.title: Killing us softly: advertising's image of women
results.creator_credit: Jean Kilbourne, Joseph Vitagliano, Patricia Stallone and Cambridge Documentary Films
results.brief_description: Using hundreds of examples from magazines, newspapers, album covers and store-front windows, this film exposes the psychological and sexual schemes that underlie many advertising campaigns. With an intriguing mixture of statistics, humour, insight and outrage, Jean Kilbourne shows her audience that although individual advertisements may seem harmless by themselves, they add up to a powerful form of cultural conditioning.

results.title: Killing Priscilla
results.creator_credit: Lizzy Gardiner, Jane Scott, A Great Scott and Film Finance Corporation Australia
results.brief_description: Not so very long ago, Stephan Elliott wrote and directed a movie called ‘The Adventures of Priscilla Queen of the Desert’ - a low-budget film that proved to be a worldwide smash grossing over a hundred million dollars at the box office. Four years and one flop (‘Welcome to Woop Woop’) later, Elliott is making ‘Eye of the beholder’ a film with a twelve million dollar budget, and an impressive cast which includes Ewan McGregor, k.d. lang, Ashley Judd and Jason Priestley. The storyline promises action-adventure in nine American cities across four different seasons. The financing has been done outside the studio system - through a team of sales agents who want a profit - or else, adding undue pressure to the project. Enter Lizzy Gardiner. Academy Award-winning costume designer and friend of Elliott’s for more than twenty years. In addition to bringing her expertise as a costume designer, Gardina also brings a Sony 1000 DVC camera, and in a moment of insanity Elliott gives her permission to document the whole process. What transpires is a no-holds-barred account of the reality of commercial filmmaking in the late 1990s: a study in passion, power, madness and lies.

results.title: Killing farm rats
results.brief_description: Portrays methods of killing rats on a large farm in Scotland. Chemical methods of control, such as gassing and pre-baiting are priveleged, but information on the long term deterence of rats is also provided.

results.title: Killer on the move
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the danger of hydatid (sheep tapeworm) infestation, common in Tasmania. Discusses the problem, particularly as it affects children, and shows briefly surgical treatment for the removal of a hydatid cyst.

results.title: Killer at large
results.creator_credit: Frank Jacoby, Alistair Cooke and United Nations Television
results.brief_description: A genial and unsuspecting businessman brings smallpox from Asia to Europe and triggers an international manhunt in which the health authorities of many countries cooperate with the Epidemic Warning Service of the World Health Organisation.
